Package it.uniud.mads.jlibbig.core

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Bigraph<C extends Control>
    Interface for immutable bigraphs.
    BigraphBuilder<C extends Control>
    Interface for mutable bigraphs.
    BigraphHandler<C extends Control>
    Interface implemented by every bigraph's class
    Child
    Place graph entities are organised in tree-like structures.
    Edge
    Edges are handles not accessible through the outer interface on the contrary of outer names (OuterName).
    Handle
    Handles are link entities identifying the hyper-edges that compose link graphs and that link points.
    InnerName
    Inner names are points accessible through the inner interface (whereas ports are not) identified by their name (cf.
    InstantiationRule<B extends Bigraph<?>>  
    LinkEntity
    Describes entities composing the link graph such as handles (Handle) and points (Point).
    LinkFacet
    Link facets are the components of link graph inner and outer interfaces and are names specialised in inner and outer ones (cf.
    Match<A extends Bigraph<?>>
    This interface describe the basic match of a bigraph in another one.
    Matcher<A extends Bigraph<?>,R extends Bigraph<?>>
    Provides services for computing the matches of a bigraph (sometimes called redex) into an other.
    Named  
    Node<C extends Control>
    Describes nodes of bigraphs for the given kind of controls.
    OuterName
    Outer names are handles accessible through the outer interface (whereas edges are not) identified by their name (cf.
    Owned
    Describes entities owned by some Owner.
    Owner
    Describes objects that can be the owner of objects exposing the Owned interface.
    Parent
    Place graph entities are organised in tree-like structures.
    PlaceEntity
    Describes entities composing the place graph such as roots (Root), nodes (Node), and sites (Site).
    Point
    Points are link entities connected by the hyper-edges composing the link graphs.
    Port<C extends Control>
    Ports are end-points for hyper-edges composing the link graphs and are exposed by nodes structured in the place graph composing the bigraph together with the aforementioned link graph.
    ReactionRule<B extends Bigraph<?>>
    A reaction rule describes how a state of a bigraphical reactive system (cf.
    ReactiveSystem<B extends Bigraph<?>>
    A bigraphical reactive system is a collection of states represented by bigraphs that can evolve by means of reactions described by a collection of reaction rules.
    RewritingRule<A extends Bigraph<?>,B extends Bigraph<?>>
    A rewriting rule is a reaction rule described by means of rewrites i.e. the reaction is a substitution of an occurrence (in the bigraph to which the rule is applied) of the rule's redex with the rule's reactum.
    RewritingSystem<A extends Bigraph<?>,B extends Bigraph<?>>
    A rewriting system is a ReactiveSystem where reactions are described by means of rewriting rules.
    Root
    Roots describe regions of the bigraph.
    Site
    Sites are leaves in the place graph structure and compose its inner interface.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractMatch<A extends Bigraph<?>>
    This class provides some support for implementing the interface .
    AbstractNamed
    Describes a name identified entity and provides some name generation methods.
    Control
    Objects created from this class are bigraphical controls describing the arity (i.e. the number of ports) of nodes decorated with it.
    Signature<C extends Control>
    Objects created from this class are bigraphical signatures.
    SignatureBuilder<C extends Control>
    The class provides methods for signature construction since Signature is immutable.
